alert.note: Alert for Juana Diaz (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 4:02AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive runoff is expected. * WHERE...Juana Diaz. * WHEN...Until 600 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rain. Additionally, river gauges indicate that Rio Jacaguas is in action stage due to excessive runoff from previous rains. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Juana Diaz, Guayabal, Luis Llorens Torres, Aguilita, Capitanejo, Coto Laurel, Potala Pastillo, Las Ollas, Rio Canas Abajo and Playita Cortada. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
